{{featured article candidates|Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik/archive1}} {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=18:44, 5 February 2015 (UTC) |action1link=Talk:Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik/GA1 |action1result=not listed |action1oldid=639562388 |action2=GAN |action2date=15:27, 22 May 2015 (UTC) |action2link=Talk:Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik/GA2 |action2result=listed |action2oldid=663553578 |action3=WAR |action3date=10:06, 2 July 2015 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik |action3result=approved |action3oldid=669593236 |currentstatus=GA |topic=Warfare }} {{Australian English}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Ships| class=A}} {{WPMILHIST|class=A|A-Class=pass|Balkan=yes|Italian=yes|German=yes|Maritime=yes|WWII=yes}} {{WikiProject Croatia|class=GA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Germany| class=GA| importance =low}} {{WikiProject Italy|class=GA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Montenegro|class=GA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Yugoslavia|class=GA|importance=low}} }} ==Requested move==
:''The following discussion is an archived discussion of a [[WP:RM|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the move request was '''no consensus'''. [[User talk:harej|@]]'''[[User:harej|harej]]''' 23:28, 17 September 2009 (UTC) ---- [[:Dubrovnik (ship)]] → [[Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik]] — Relisted for further input on which is the preferred name here: [[Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik]], or [[JRM Dubrovnik]]. [[User:Jafeluv|Jafeluv]] ([[User talk:Jafeluv|talk]]) 12:30, 9 September 2009 (UTC) This article was created under this name and moved without discussion. The suggestion (and original name) better meets the naming conventions at [[WP:NC-SHIPS]]. — [[User:Bellhalla|Bellhalla]] ([[User talk:Bellhalla|talk]]) 11:39, 27 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Support'''. Consistent with the ship naming guideline for military ships. Perhaps [[Jadran (ship)]] should be moved as well? [[User:Jafeluv|Jafeluv]] ([[User talk:Jafeluv|talk]]) 22:06, 27 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Grudging Support''''''Oppose''' in favor of correct title, see below. — I know that there was a "standard ship prefix" for Kingdom of Yugoslavia ships, I just can't remember or locate it right now...
— [[User:Ohms law|V = I * R]] ([[User talk:Ohms law|talk]]) 05:02, 28 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Support''' - per nom and to meet naming conventions. [[User:Benea|Benea]] ([[User talk:Benea|talk]]) 03:30, 29 August 2009 (UTC) JRM Dubrovnik. The standard ship prefix is "'''JRM'''" ('''''J'''ugoslavenska '''R'''atna '''M'''ornarica'', Yugoslav War Navy). The problem of course, is that this ship served in the Italian and German navies. --[[User:DIREKTOR|DIREKTOR]] ([[User talk:DIREKTOR|TALK]]) 08:51, 29 August 2009 (UTC) :Yes! Thank you, I knew there was a prefix... I do see where it did later serve in the Italian and German navies, but is that really a problem? I'd think that we'd want it to reside at it's original name ([[JRM Dubrovnik]]) and have redirects from it's later names.
— [[User:Ohms law|V = I * R]] ([[User talk:Ohms law|talk to Ω]]) 12:28, 29 August 2009 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of a [[WP:RM|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page. No further edits should be made to this section.
== Move to Yugoslav destroyer ''Dubrovnik'' == Despite the assertion in the above RM, a Google search for the current title shows no hits for reliable sources using JRM as the official prefix for Royal Yugoslav Navy ships. The title of this article should therefore be the standard MOS for ships, "Yugoslav destroyer ''Dubrovnik''". Thoughts? [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|send... over]]) 22:58, 3 September 2013 (UTC) ==Requested move==
:''The following discussion is an archived discussion of the proposal. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the proposal was '''moved'''. --[[User:BDD|BDD]] ([[User talk:BDD|talk]]) 21:02, 20 September 2013 (UTC) [[:JRM Dubrovnik]] → {{no redirect|Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik}} – [[WP:NC-SHIPS]]. A Google Books [https://www.google.com.au/search?q=%22JRM+Dubrovnik%22&btnG=Search+Books&tbm=bks&tbo=1#q=%22JRM+Dubrovnik%22+-wikipedia+-%22Books%2C+LLC%22&tbm=bks search] for the current title shows no hits for reliable sources using JRM as the official prefix for this ship. [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|send... over]]) 08:58, 11 September 2013 (UTC) *Support "Yugoslav destroyer Dubrovnik". Note lower case d. [[User:Srnec|Srnec]] ([[User talk:Srnec|talk]]) 19:56, 11 September 2013 (UTC) :*Good point, my mistake. I have amended the proposed move to properly reflect NC-SHIPS. Thanks. [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|send... over]]) 23:47, 11 September 2013 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the proposal. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page. No further edits should be made to this section.
== Ship Prefix == According to this picture http://www.barper.com/en/NUMIZMATIKA-MILITARIJA-XXXVI/Militaria/Kraljevski-brod-Dubrovnik/36/456/28686/, the full name of ship was Kraljevski brod Dubrovnik, Royal Ship ''Dubrovnik''. So, the standard ship prefix should be "KB", that was the prefix of Yugoslav Royal Navy. --[[User:N Jordan|N Jordan]] ([[User talk:N Jordan|talk]]) 03:42, 24 August 2014 (UTC) :Do you have a reliable source for that? Regards, [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|send... over]]) 03:44, 24 August 2014 (UTC) ::I couldn't find anything written in English. Here is a [[tally]], an inscribed silk ribbon with a name of the ship, that was tied around the base of a sailor cap: http://www.paluba.info/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=3489.0;attach=345702;image Here is text from [[Government gazette]] http://www.paluba.info/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=24733.0;attach=593922;image However they don't use "KB" but "Kr. brod" for ships, "Kr. torpiljirka" for torpedo boats, and "Kr. drager" for minesweepers. --[[User:N Jordan|N Jordan]] ([[User talk:N Jordan|talk]]) 16:53, 1 September 2014 (UTC) :::It is about what the ship is called in English, and as you have said there isn't any mention of this prefix in English sources that I am aware of. These also seem quite unwieldy for an article title. REgards, [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|send... over]]) 03:37, 2 September 2014 (UTC) == Navypedia == I'm afraid that navypedia isn't a reliable source. I suggest Jane's or similar sources would be appropriate. [[User:Peacemaker67|Peacemaker67]] ([[User_talk:Peacemaker67#top|crack... thump]]) 20:38, 24 October 2014 (UTC) :Honestly, I had a feeling that Navypeadia isn't such a good source, that's why I already got a few more that are reliable and actually have more info about the ship (Jane's, Conway's and such). I actually wrote the lead and development section based on them, but I just didn't have time to list them after finishing so I thought to do it later on. I'll get to it as soon as possible and continue with the article.--[[User:Saxum|Saxum]] ([[User talk:Saxum|talk]]) 08:52, 25 October 2014 (UTC)
